intro: Polyalthia novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea flame tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the rainforests of New Guinea. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall, with smooth, greyish-brown bark and glossy, elliptical leaves. Its flowers are not only visually appealing but also serve as a food source for various pollinators. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value in warm climates due to its vibrant floral display.
